properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong westerly winds, gusting to 90 km/h, continue to produce widespread blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Blizzard conditions will end by this evening for all regions as the winds weaken. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T04:59:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T16:24:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4080049059.2020
Area: Sachs Harbour, Ulukhaktok, Paulatuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow continue. Blizzard conditions continue in Resolute with strong easterly winds, gusting up to 80 km/h. Blizzard conditions will end this afternoon as the wind weakens. However, periods of blowing snow may continue into Monday evening. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-15T21:59:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T14:18:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1584734106.2020
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Gusty easterly winds will combine with cold arctic air to produce wind chill values near minus 35 for Yoho Park - Kootenay Park this morning.. Conditions will improve later today. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T03:00:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T11:01:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2038625813.2020
Area: Yoho Park - Kootenay Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills continues. Extreme cold wind chill values near minus 40 are occurring this morning. Conditions will moderate this afternoon as temperatures rise. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-15T20:59:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T10:29:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0320771196.2020

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Arctic outflow winds of 80 km/h gusting to 100 will continue to blow over southern sections of Howe Sound including Bowen Island late this morning. Winds are expected to ease near noon. Wind speeds will increase again tonight with northerly winds gusting to 80 km/h possible over southern sections of Howe Sound. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T09:49:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T17:50:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3202572941.2020
Area: Howe Sound
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected. Blizzard conditions will continue in Kugluktuk today with strong northwest winds, gusting up to 80 km/h. Conditions will improve near midnight tonight as the wind weakens. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected. Blizzard conditions are expected to develop in Gjoa Haven and Taloyoak this evening as the wind strengthens from the northeast, with gusts up to 80 km/h possible. Conditions will improve early Monday morning when the wind weakens. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T06:13:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T14:14:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0493506240.2020
Area: Taloyoak, Gjoa Haven
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winds gusting upwards of 100 kilometres per hour are occurring in this region. These winds will diminish through the night. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T11:13:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-15T19:14:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3117985771.2020
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada
